Definitions: The date on which the terms and conditions of the contract become enforceable.
The entity that owns the project site and enters into the contract with the EPC contractor for the construction of the solar energy facility.
The name of the contractor responsible for engineering, procurement, and construction services under the agreement.
The total capacity of the solar power system to be installed, usually measured in megawatts (MW) or kilowatts (kW).
The physical location where the solar power facility is to be constructed.
Current phase of the construction process, typically described as planned, in progress, or completed.
The duration for which the EPC agreement is valid and enforceable.
The point at which the installation of all major equipment is completed and the system is capable of operating in a standalone mode, although it may not yet be connected to the grid.
The stage at which the solar facility is deemed sufficiently complete, according to the contract specifications, to begin functional operation, pending minor finishing works.
The stage at which all construction activities have been completed, all systems are operational, final inspections have been passed, and all contractual obligations are fulfilled.
The scheduled date by which mechanical completion is expected to be achieved as per the contract.

Key Items: Is Substantial Completion Date within 3 months of Mechanical Completion Date?
Definitions: Indicates whether the substantial completion date falls within three months after the mechanical completion date, as specified in the contract.
The scheduled date by which substantial completion is expected to be achieved as outlined in the contract.

Key Items: Are Liquidated Damages Associated with Substantial Completion Date?
Definitions: Specifies whether there are financial penalties (liquidated damages) associated for failing to meet the substantial completion date.
The date on which the solar facility starts commercial operation after successful testing and commissioning.
The date when the final completion is achieved as per the contractual terms.
Circumstances under which the owner may be considered in default, such as failure to make payments or provide necessary permissions.
Circumstances under which the contractor may be considered in default, such as delays, failure to meet specifications, or non-compliance with safety standards.
Conditions under which the owner has the right to terminate the contract.
Conditions under which the contractor has the right to terminate the contract.
Details of any guarantees provided by the contractor on materials, labor, and system performance.
Formal assurances or promises regarding certain aspects of the project such as system performance or completion timelines.

Clauses that release both parties from liability or obligation when an extraordinary event or circumstance beyond the control of the parties, such as a natural disaster, prevents one or both parties from fulfilling their contractual obligations.
Conditions under which the owner can transfer their rights and obligations under the contract to another party.
Conditions under which the contractor can transfer their rights and obligations under the contract to another party.
Details regarding any legal right or interest that the contractor or others may have on the property, until certain debts arising out of the construction are cleared.
A comprehensive overview of the financial aspects of the project, including payment terms, pricing structure, and cost allocation.
Details of taxes applicable to the project, who is responsible for them, and how they are to be handled.

Key Items: Mechanical Completion - Notification to REA by Developer
Definitions: Procedure for notifying the relevant energy authority by the developer once mechanical completion is achieved.
The time period allowed for the energy authority or the owner to review and assess the mechanical completion before giving approval.
Process by which mechanical completion is formally accepted by the owner or the authority.
Conditions and process for rejection of the mechanical completion if it does not meet the specified standards or requirements.

Key Items: Substantial Completion - Notification to REA by Developer
Definitions: Procedure for notifying the relevant energy authority by the developer once substantial completion is achieved.
The time period allowed for the energy authority or the owner to review and assess the substantial completion before giving approval.
Process by which substantial completion is formally accepted by the owner or the authority.
Conditions and process for rejection of the substantial completion if it does not meet the specified standards or requirements.

Key Items: Final Completion - Notification to REA by Developer
Definitions: Procedure for notifying the relevant energy authority by the developer once final completion is achieved.
The time period allowed for the energy authority or the owner to review and assess the final completion before giving approval.
Process by which final completion is formally accepted by the owner or the authority.
Conditions and process for rejection of the final completion if it does not meet the specified standards or requirements.
Advance payment that may be required before contract signing for securing module procurement.
Date of execution of the EPC agreement or issuance of the Letter of Notice to Proceed.
Issuance of the second Letter of Notice to Proceed if applicable, marking another phase of project progression.
Formal notice given by the owner to the contractor to begin or continue work according to the contract terms.
The date by which the site preparation is expected to be completed.
Scheduled date for the delivery of racking systems to the project site.
Scheduled date for the delivery of solar modules to the project site.

Key Items: Delivery of Inverters & Energy Storage Unit to Site
Definitions: Scheduled date for the delivery of inverters and any associated energy storage units to the project site.
The process and timeline for the installation of racking systems that will hold the solar panels.
The process and timeline for the installation of solar modules onto the racking systems.
The process and timeline for the installation of inverters and any energy storage units.
Confirmation that all mechanical components of the solar project have been installed and are ready for testing.
Testing conducted in the presence of both parties (or their representatives) to verify that the system meets the contractual and operational specifications.
Permission to Operate - official approval from the relevant authorities allowing the solar facility to be connected to the grid and start operations.
The point at which the photovoltaic components of the project are considered substantially complete.
The point at which the energy storage system (if applicable) is considered substantially complete.
The date or condition under which the project is considered fully complete, with all contractual obligations fulfilled.
